description: The year I rebuilt my blog to match who I had grown into, not who I used to be.

Blog v2 wasnâ€™t just a redesign; it was a reset of tone, structure, and intentionâ€”a place that felt closer to who I had become and where I wanted to go next. This version is where all the threads meet: past lessons, current projects, and the stories Iâ€™m still in the middle of writing."}),"\n",t("a",{href:"https://stephen-v2-me.vercel.app/",target:"_blank",children:t(o.p,{children:"#Personal Blog V2"})})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:n}=e.components||{};return n?t(n,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Born into a New Millennium
description: The year my version 0.0 quietly booted into the world ðŸš€
body: const{Fragment:t,jsx:e,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(o){const r={p:"p",...o.components};return n(t,{children:[e(r.p,{children:'In 2000, I officially crash-landed on Earth - my own little "Day Of Arrival" at the edge of a new millennium. It didn\'t look special from the outside, but for me it was Day Zero - the year my version 0.0 quietly booted into the world.'}),"\n",e("img",{src:"/assets/articles/retro/i-arrive.gif",alt:"this-is-how-it-looks"}),"\n",e("u",{children:"This is pretty much how it looked in my mind ðŸ‘€"})]})}return{default:function(t={}){const{wrapper:n}=t.components||{};return n?e(n,{...t,children:e(_createMdxContent,{...t})}):_createMdxContent(t)}};

title: When Self-Work Became the Real Work
description: The year I finally understood why working on myself matters more than working on my job.
body: const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:o}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(n){const r={p:"p",...n.components},{RoughMark:a}=r;return a||function(e,t){throw new Error("Expected "+(t?"component":"object")+" `"+e+"` to be defined: you likely forgot to import, pass, or provide it.")}("RoughMark",!0),o(e,{children:[t(r.p,{children:"In 2024, Jim Rohn's line finally hit me for real:"}),"\n",t(a,{type:"highlight",multiline:!0,color:"#ffe066",children:t("span",{style:{color:"#000"},children:"Learn to work harder on yourself than you do on your job. If you work hard on your job you can make a living, but if you work hard on yourself you'll make a fortune."})}),"\n",t(r.p,{children:'Until then, I mostly treated "self-improvement" like a nice-to-have, something I\'d do when I had time. This was the year I started to see my mind, my skills, and my habits as the real assets â€” not the job title on my profile. It changed how I spent my evenings, what I paid attention to, and what I expected from my future self.'})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:o}=e.components||{};return o?t(o,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Outgrowing My Old Job
description: The year I admitted my old company no longer fit and bet on my own growth instead.
body: const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(o){const r={p:"p",...o.components};return n(e,{children:[t(r.p,{children:"2024 was the year I finally admitted it to myself: my old company wasn't the problem, it just wasn't the right fit for who I was becoming. I had outgrown the role, the pace, and the way things were done there."}),"\n",t(r.p,{children:"Instead of complaining, I decided to shift my focus inward â€” to study properly, to stop half-learning, and to pour my energy into personal projects. The first real result of that decision was my original personal blog, a tiny website that somehow opened the door to my current job and eventually evolved into this version 2 you're reading now. It wasn't a clean break or a heroic moment, just a quiet decision to take myself more seriously."})]})}return{default:function(e={}){const{wrapper:n}=e.components||{};return n?t(n,{...e,children:t(_createMdxContent,{...e})}):_createMdxContent(e)}};

title: Launching My First Personal Blog ðŸ—¿

body: const{Fragment:e,jsx:t,jsxs:n}=arguments[0];function _createMdxContent(a){const r={p:"p",...a.components};return n(e,{children:[t(r.p,{children:"In 2024, I launched my first personal blog. It wasn't perfect, the design was a bit rough, and the content didn't always know what it wanted to beâ€”but it was real and it was mine.
